channel.title: The Straits Times Singapore News
channel.description: The Straits Times - Get exclusive stories, in-depth analyses and award-winning multimedia content about Singapore, Asia and the world.

item.title: 481 new Covid-19 cases in Singapore, including 5 in the community and 4 imported
item.description:
July 26, 2020 3:42 PM

The 5 community cases are work pass holders and the 4 imported cases had been placed on stay-home notices upon arrival in Singapore.

item.title: NDP 2020 scaled down with around 150 parade spectators and 300 participants in total: Ng Eng Hen
item.description:
July 26, 2020 2:00 PM

There will be around 50 representatives of the Government, including ministers, watching the morning parade and around 100 members of the public as spectators.

item.title: Front-line workers, including nurses, to receive salute in NDP 2020
item.description:
July 26, 2020 2:00 PM

SINGAPORE - Military Expert 2 (ME2) Muhammad Khairunnizam Amran's decade-long involvement in National Day Parades (NDP) will be marked with a special one on August 9, which is being held amid the Covid-19 pandemic.

item.title: Investigations into Dickson Yeo case 'have not revealed any direct threat to Singapore's security' : MHA
item.description:
July 26, 2020 11:36 AM

SINGAPORE - Investigations into the case of Dickson Yeo, a Singaporean who pleaded guilty on Friday (July 24) to acting under the direction of Chinese intelligence officials to obtain sensitive information from Americans, have not revealed any direct threat to Singapore's security, said the Ministry of Home Affairs (MHA) on Sunday (Jul 26).

item.title: Coronavirus: Singapore-Malaysia travel arrangements for permit holders, business travellers finalised
item.description:
July 26, 2020 10:42 AM

Details on reciprocal green lane and for periodic arrangement will be published in the next few days, while proposal for daily commuters crossing the border for work is being discussed.

item.title: Morning Briefing: Top stories from The Straits Times on July 26
New podcast channels for ST & BT specialist shows
item.description:
July 26, 2020 6:30 AM

Discover a range of podcasts that include ST's Health Check and BT's Money Hacks.

item.title: Six months of Covid-19 in Singapore: A timeline
Six months of Covid-19 in Singapore: A special report
item.description:
July 26, 2020 5:30 AM

It was Jan 23 when Singapore registered its first infected patient case and still the battle against the pandemic goes on. Insight looks at how the lessons learnt are shaping the future.

item.title: 11 more dorms cleared of Covid-19; Balestier hotel among places visited by infectious patients
item.description:
July 26, 2020 5:00 AM

Eleven more dormitories have been cleared of the coronavirus, said the Ministry of Health (MOH) last night.

item.title: It Changed My Life: 'I want eggs, good ones,' says top fertility expert
item.description:
July 26, 2020 5:00 AM

As a popular obstetrician and gynaecologist, Dr Ann Tan is always busy. The last few months of the year, however, are especially hectic.

item.title: SMC may take disciplinary action against acquitted doctor
item.description:
July 26, 2020 5:00 AM

The Singapore Medical Council (SMC) is deciding whether to bring disciplinary proceedings against general practitioner Wee Teong Boo, who, by his own admission, had inserted ungloved fingers into a female patient during a supposed pelvic examination.

item.title: Coronavirus: Singapore's last-line defenders make critical decisions daily to save patients in the ICU
item.description:
July 26, 2020 5:00 AM

There have been no Covid-19 patients at the intensive care unit at the National Centre For Infectious Diseases (NCID) since June 15.

item.title: IBM, Shopee among firms to offer training for mid-career job seekers
item.description:
July 26, 2020 5:00 AM

Mid-career job seekers can now apply for training courses offered by firms in in-demand sectors to help boost their employability.

item.title: Former infantry officer diagnosed with Covid-19 spent nearly 70 days in TTSH-NCID
item.description:
July 26, 2020 5:00 AM

Mr Wong Shin Liang, 71, used to be able to lustily belt out several numbers at one ago at home or in a karaoke club.

item.title: 65 mosques to host Hari Raya Haji prayers this Friday
item.description:
July 26, 2020 5:00 AM

Some 8,750 Muslims will be able to perform their Hari Raya Haji prayers at 65 mosques across Singapore this week, although the Islamic Religious Council of Singapore (Muis) continues to encourage families to conduct prayers at home.

item.title: Docs learn more about treatment
item.description:
July 26, 2020 5:00 AM

Some Covid-19 patients are reporting that their recovery is taking longer than expected, as they experience shortness of breath and fatigue. Some have problems focusing, and headaches and dizziness, while others suffer anxiety and post-traumatic stress disorder.

item.title: Novel approaches for a novel coronavirus
item.description:
July 26, 2020 5:00 AM

Clad in overalls and equipped with N95 masks and face shields, a trio of scientists huddled over a manhole outside a foreign worker dormitory. They warned the media gathered around them last Wednesday: "Stay at least 2m away."

item.title: Singapore Covid-19 survivor still haunted by flashbacks of his stay in ICU
item.description:
July 26, 2020 5:00 AM

When Mr Ben Ng, 55, fell severely ill with Covid-19 in March, he spent 13 days in the intensive care unit (ICU).

item.title: Working from home works, but the office has its place too
item.description:
July 26, 2020 5:00 AM

Some companies had to make radical changes after Covid-19 broke out in Singapore in order to allow staff to work from home.

item.title: Contact tracing: Plug the public transport gap
item.description:
July 26, 2020 5:00 AM

It is a common sight at train and bus stations: Commuters walk past the QR code on display without scanning it. Even on taxis, few people scan the QR code to log their entries and exits by supplying the Government with their contact information and identity number.

item.title: Dickson Yeo’s PhD supervisor was expelled academic Huang Jing, says Bilahari Kausikan
item.description:
July 26, 2020 5:00 AM

Yeo Jun Wei, also known as Dickson Yeo, studied at National Junior College from 1998 to 1999 and then went on to secure a Bachelor of Arts in mass communication and media studies from Oklahoma City University.

item.title: Global infections up by millions a week
item.description:
July 26, 2020 5:00 AM

One hundred hours. That's all it took for global coronavirus infections to rise by a million in the five days leading up to last Saturday a week ago.

item.title: Lessons from high-density dorms spark new approach
item.description:
July 26, 2020 5:00 AM

For months, foreign worker dormitories have been Singapore's biggest Covid-19 challenge. At one point, new cases in dorms were hovering at close to 1,000 a day, and virtually all dormitories were put under effective lockdown.

item.title: Singapore could start Covid-19 vaccine human trials this week
item.description:
July 26, 2020 5:00 AM

Human trials for a Covid-19 vaccine could begin in Singapore as early as this week.

item.title: Liu Thai Ker on Singapore identity, Covid-19 and that 10 million number
item.description:
July 26, 2020 5:00 AM

Growing up as a young boy in Singapore in the 1940s, Mr Liu Thai Ker wondered why British colonial officials lived in such different housing from the locals.

item.title: Firm sees silver lining in staff loyalty and spirit amid crisis
item.description:
July 26, 2020 5:00 AM

When the Covid-19 pandemic first struck Singapore, local horticultural firm Nature Landscapes knew it had to be prepared for business to be hit.

item.title: Coronavirus: SingHealth team pre-empts ventilator shortage by developing its own
item.description:
July 26, 2020 5:00 AM

A locally designed, cost-effective ventilator whose production can be scaled up easily is close to fruition.

item.title: Man and woman charged with killing the woman's daughter
item.description:
July 26, 2020 5:00 AM

A 33-year-old man and a 24-year-old woman were charged yesterday with the murder of the woman's four-year-old daughter.

item.title: New Cabinet balances continuity, exposure, renewal
Singapore in multilateral initiative to secure Covid-19 vaccine doses
item.description:
July 26, 2020 5:00 AM

Global anticipation for a Covid-19 vaccine has heightened in the light of promising findings from early-stage human trials.

item.title: COE quota for period from August to October shrinks
item.description:
July 26, 2020 5:00 AM

Car buyers face a smaller supply of certificates of entitlement (COEs) for the August-October quota period, with 6,207 COEs available for bidding in each of those months, the Land Transport Authority (LTA) announced yesterday.

item.title: Coronavirus: Many beachgoers abide by mask and safe distancing rules
item.description:
July 26, 2020 5:00 AM

A day after new measures were announced to restrict the large number of people flocking to beaches, many were still out and about yesterday, enjoying the sun and playing in the surf.

item.title: SSO virtual concert for Botanic Gardens milestone
item.description:
July 26, 2020 5:00 AM

To celebrate the Singapore Botanic Gardens' fifth anniversary as a Unesco World Heritage Site this year, the National Parks Board (NParks) has teamed up with the Singapore Symphony Orchestra (SSO) to hold a virtual concert.
